courses.title: Gateway to Political Science Course
courses.notes: Can be POLS 2330, POLS 2340, POLS 2350.

courses.title: Gateway to Political Science Course
courses.notes: Can be POLS 2330, POLS 2340, POLS 2350, or ECON 2301. Note: May not take both POLS 2350 and ECON 2301 to fulfill the Gateway to Political Science requirement.

courses.title: U.S. Political Institutions & State/Local Politics
courses.prerequisite: POLS 2305. POLS 3310, POLS 3311, and POLS 3319 have a prerequisite of both POLS 2305 and POLS 2306. Additionally, POLS 3319 requires acceptance into the Archer Center program.
courses.notes: See Degree Plan for List of Courses. Note: POLS 4310, POLS 4311, and POLS 4312 may not be used to satisfy both U.S. Political Institutions & State/Local Politics requirement and a requirement for the Legal Studies minor if selected.

courses.title: Advanced Political Science Elective
courses.prerequisite: POLS 2305; pending course selection may also require POLS 2306
courses.notes: See options on degree plan. Students may take 3 credit hours of POLS 3190 or POLS 3393 to satisfy 3 of the 6 credit hours for the advanced electives in political science. POLS 3390 may be taken no more than twice (6 hours) for credit; topics must be different. Only 3 credit hours of POLS 3391 will be accepted to satisfy 3 of the 6 credit hours for the advanced electives in political science. Only 3 credit hours of POLS 3392 will be accepted to satisfy 3 of the 6 credit hours for the advanced electives in political science.

Only 3 credit hours of POLS 3391 will be accepted to satisfy 3 of the 6 credit hours for the advanced electives in political science. Only 3 credit hours of POLS 3392 will be accepted to satisfy 3 of the 6 credit hours for the advanced electives in political science.
